thread.title: People magazine recalls shooting in Menasha
thread.title_full: People magazine recalls shooting in Menasha

title: People magazine recalls shooting in Menasha
text:
People magazine recalls shooting in Menasha Duke Behnke , Post-Crescent Media 4:49 p.m. CDT October 20, 2015 Buy Photo The May 3 shooting on the Fox Cities Trestle Trail drew a large police response. (Photo: Wm. Glasheen/Post-Crescent Media) Buy Photo 1 CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Oct. 19 edition of People magazine recalls the May 3 shooting on the Fox Cities Trestle Trail in Menasha that left four people dead and another critically injured. 
The Menasha tragedy is part of a larger story on the Oct. 1 mass shooting at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Ore., that left 10 people dead. 
The magazine's coverage includes a section titled "Remembering the Lost" for people killed in mass shootings in the past year. In addition to Menasha and Roseburg, shootings occurred at a church in Charleston, S.C.; at military facilities in Chattanooga, Tenn.; at a theater in Lafayette, La.; and at a high school in Marysville, Wash. 
READ MORE: Fox Cities Trestle Trail Bridge Shooting 
The entry on the Trestle Trail shooting includes photographs of victims Jonathan Stoffel, 33, and Adam Bentdahl, 31, and it mentions victim Olivia Stoffel, 11. They died on the bridge after being shot at random by Menasha gunman Sergio Valencia del Toro, who then fatally shot himself. 
Erin Stoffel — Jonathan's wife and Olivia's mother — also was shot by Valencia del Toro. She survived. 
Toxicology results revealed Valencia del Toro's blood-alcohol level was 0.24 percent — three times the legal limit for driving — when he opened fire on the bridge. 
Police said Valencia del Toro had suicidal and homicidal ideas dating to 2010, according to behavioral health records obtained by the FBI. 
Duke Behnke: 920-993-7176, or dbehnke@postcrescent.com; on Twitter @DukeBehnke 1 CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://post.cr/1RUE3Mo TOP VIDEOS
